alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:31PM EST until January 12 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, Chesterfield and City of Richmond Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Westham. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Approximately 20 acres of lowland flooded in vicinity of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Friday was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 10.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 12/29/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 9 pm EST tonight.this evening at 900 PM EST.
